intro: Carduus poliochrus, commonly known as the pale centaury, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa, where it thrives in dry, rocky habitats. The plant features spiny, hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine layer of white hairs. Its flowers are yellow and arranged in a composite head, typical of the daisy family. Carduus poliochrus is often found in open fields and along roadsides, where it contributes to the biodiversity of its ecosystem.
